channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Two Priorities Defining Healthcare CIOs In 2026
item.description: What healthcare CIOs must focus on in 2026: scaling AI beyond pilots and leading with a growth mindset as partnerships, M&A, and complexity reshape th...

item.title: Trump narrows Fed chair picks, January decision expected
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's term ends in May 2026, but President Trump plans to pick his replacement by January.

item.title: Canadian stocks set record for records in ‘jaw-dropping’ year
item.description: “The numbers themselves are somewhat jaw dropping,” said IG Wealth Management chief investment strategist Philip Petursson by phone.

item.title: Dollar set for worst year since 2017 with Fed drama center stage
item.description: “The biggest factor for the dollar in first quarter will be the Fed,” said Yusuke Miyairi, a foreign-exchange strategist at Nomura.

item.title: The Modifier That ‘Destiny 2’ Needs To Delete Forever
item.description: Destiny 2 is pretty fun in the Renegades era, but there's one modifier that is only getting worse as time goes on, and it needs to go.

item.title: 12 Essential Multiplayer Games That Made 2025 Way More Enjoyable
item.description: It's the end of 2025. You want to know what the best multiplayer games of 2025 are. I’ll tell you what: there’s no shortage of them.

item.title: Gold and silver stumble at the end of best year since the 1970s
item.description: “In my career, it’s unprecedented,” said John Reade, a market veteran and chief strategist at the World Gold Council.

item.title: How AI Shrinks Innovation Cycle Time
item.description: Accelerate innovation through process-level implementation of AI. Increase agility; cut cycle times; improve organizational learning.

item.title: China buys two-thirds of pledged U.S. soybeans as 2025 closes
item.description: The return of Chinese buyers is welcome news for U.S. exporters, and a reminder that buying patterns can change fast — but it is not yet a full reset.

item.title: Court rules Trump administration must fund consumer finance watchdog
item.description: A federal judge ruled the Trump administration must secure CFPB funding after blocking shutdown attempts. The consumer protection agency faces critica...

item.title: Mortgage rates hit 2025 low as homebuyers catch a break
item.description: Mortgage rates drop to their lowest point in 2025, offering potential relief for homebuyers in today's competitive housing market across the nation.

item.title: Why ‘Aliro’, The New Smart Lock Standard, Matters For The Smart Home
item.description: Aliro, the smart lock standard expected to be released in 2026, will let us open doors just by tapping our smart phones and watches. Read on to find o...

item.title: Copper records biggest annual gain since 2009 on supply bets
item.description: Copper had its best year since 2009, fueled by near-term supply tightness and bets that demand for the metal key in electrification will outpace produ...

item.title: The Times Square ball drop doesn’t belong on your bucket list. Nothing does.
5 things you should know before you sell your silver coins, jewelry or flatware
These 5 charts define the wild year for global financial markets in 2025
Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq all lower in final trading hour of 2025 — follow live
German stocks had their best year since 2019
IRS hands workers bigger tax break for business expenses in 2026
item.description: Gig workers get a tax break with higher mileage rates for 2026. The IRS increased business driving deductions to 72.5 cents per mile from last year.

item.title: Further rate cuts in question as Fed policymakers deeply divided over December cut, minutes show
item.description: Federal Reserve policymakers were split on December's rate cut decision, with multiple dissents revealing disagreements over inflation and labor risks...

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
